active_learning.discussion_prompt: In the context of long-term containment strategies, debate whether a standardized security baseline (e.g., NIST SP 800-53B low vs. high-impact) should be universally enforced or tailored per system risk profile. Support arguments with pros/cons, real-world examples from incident response (e.g., NIST SP 800-61), and references to benchmarks/controls.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in 'Security Baseline Enforcement' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 002_Incident Response And Forensics > Incident 003_Containment Strategies > Long-Term 003_Containment Strategies > 008_System Hardening and Configuration Management > Security Baseline Enforcement). Incorporate this research context: Security baseline = minimum security for workloads (Centraleyes); Benchmark = aspirational standard; Controls = measures to prevent attacks; Links to NIST SP 800-61 (IR), SP 800-53B (baselines: low/moderate/high). OSPS Baseline: Open-source hardening for reproducible enforcement. Use these pedagogical elements: - Learning Objectives: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM JSON] - Active Learning: [INSERT FULL DETAILS FROM JSON] (reference in explanations) - Scaffolding: [INSERT FULL LAYERS FROM JSON] (tag each card to a layer) Generate 25 high-quality flashcards following the Flashcard Schema exactly: [INSERT FULL SCHEMA FROM JSON] Ensure active recall: Questions test higher-order thinking where possible. Output as JSON array: [{'type': 'basic|multiple_choice', 'front': '...', 'back': {...}, 'objective_covered': '...', 'layer': 1-4, 'sources': ['NIST SP 800-53B']}, ...]. Vary formats, cover all objectives/layers uniformly. No duplicates; make distractors challenging per protocol.
